title: Drawing, "Venus and Cupid, Study after Annibale Carracci", 1821–1822
medium: Pen and ink, brush and brown wash over black chalk on heavy white paper
inscribed: in pen and brown ink at center left: Anibale Carraci Bologna; at lower left: 11 Gulielmo della Porta Roma
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Upper drawing of Venus seated on clouds, holding apple(?) in left hand; at left, Cupid with his bow and quiver of arrows. Lower drawing of two putti at left, posed like caryatids, holding draperies. Background shows balustrade with suggestion of coat-of-arms at right.
